comment.author: 97681241@N08
comment._content:
The Station building was constructed in 1909 at 9th and Washington to replace the original station building at the same location, which was constructed in 1887 by the Willamette Valley and Coast Railroad.
In 1917, the subject Station was moved to 6th and Monroe to serve the new electric interurban service instituted by the SP to counter the competition from the other interurban railway in town, the Oregon Electric.
